moves.1. Nf3:
Hi everyone!

In this unrated game my opponent launches a kingside mating attack which included a speculative exchange sacrifice.  Somehow I managed to beat this one off and later on in the game I returned the compliment.  But which player triumphed?  Well, read on and see.  I start this game with my now usual Reti Opening 1.Nf3.
moves.5. Qa4+ Bd7 6. Qh4: 6. Qh4 - Glenda is waiting to welcome the BK should he go kingside.
moves.6... Nb6 7. d4 Bg7 8. Bh6: 8. Bh6 - threatening the usual fianchetto bishop trade off to weaken the black squares on the kingside.
moves.13. a3 Qd7 14. Rd1 O-O-O 15. O-O: 15. 0-0 - both players castle on opposite sides.  This usually means a kingside/queenside mating attack race.
moves.19. Qg3 g5 20. Qxg5: 20. Qxg5 - Ella offers a pawn and Glenda zaps it.  But is it a mistake?  We shall see.
moves.22. Nh4 Qe4 23. g3: 23. g3 - now Henry is starting to feel a little draughty.  Thank heaven Ella's light square bishop is off the board.  Queen Ella would certainly be much more of a threat than she is now.
moves.23... Rd7 24. Ng2 Qf3: 24. ……. Qf3 - Queen Ella comes further in but Glenda also has ideas of gatecrashing black's position.
moves.25. Qe8+ Nd8: 25. ….. Nd8 - the only way to avoid losing a second pawn (e6).
moves.29. h3 Rxg3+: 29. ….. Rxg3+ here is Ella's rook sacrifice.
moves.30. fxg3 Qxg3+ 31. Kh1 Qxe3: 31. ….. Qxe3 - Queen Ella mercilessly zaps my pawns.
moves.32. Qf3 Qxd4: 32. ….. Qxd4 - Queen Ella does not Zap Glenda and instead zaps yet another white pawn.
moves.34... Re8 35. Rd1 Qf6 36. Rxc6: 36. Rxc6 - Here is my exchange sac and this prompts an immediate resignation on the grounds of ruinous loss of material as if Ella accepts it, Glenda will take on c6 threatening both Qa8# and Qxe8+ Qd8, Qxd8#.  This is now my third Expert Victory - what a twist!
